content: for the next 10 rounds *use whatever color combos speak to you ©ashleymaglich you are just going to do 3dc ch2 3dc at every corner space 3dc in non corner spaces *just like you would a regular granny hexagon for color changes i personally start in a corner spot ch3 *counting as 1st double_crochet 2dc ch2 3dc then continue with the pattern of a granny hexagon i also work over my tails as i go but certainly do what feels comfortable for you *you should have 12 granny rounds counting round 1 round 13 flatten your hexagon so you have 3 straight sides ©ashleymaglich you are now going to make 3dc clusters around these sides starting from the bottom & working your way up over & down *make sure you still make your corner spaces 3dc ch2 3dc ©ashleymaglich round 14-21 you are now going to be working on the leg of the stocking you can certainly make more row than i did however i did 8 row of granny clusters these are going to be alternating row so your row stay even you are going to be working just on the top of the hexagon shape now building up row 14 - ch3 double_crochet in the first space *if you are right handed like i am you will be working in the right corner space* then continue with 3dc clusters until the last stitch & make 2dc ch1 & fo ©ashleymaglich row 15 - you re going to ch3 in between the 2dc from last round then start your 3dc clusters in the next space until you reach the 2dc then 1dc in between them ch1 & fo ©ashleymaglich these are the row you will alternate until you reach your 8 row or your desired length *it s important to note try & have somewhat of a loose gauge if that s hard for you to do then i would recommend you size up a hook size for this part ©ashleymaglich once you reach your 8rows or desired length you are now going to stitch your stocking closed fold the hexagon in an l shape to where the right sides are together *what i mean by this is the sides where your ends are not hanging out you can usually tell which side is the right & wrong sides note i like how the stocking looks both ways with the single_crochet stitching inside & outside it s just a personal preference if you want to see what the single_crochet stitching looks like scroll down in the pattern so you can certainly keep your stocking where the right sides are showing & do your single_crochet where they show vs having them on the inside of the stocking & having to flip it inside out afterall this pattern is simply a guide let your imagination & creativity take you where it may ©ashleymaglich ©ashleymaglich insert your hook into the first stitch at the top of the stocking pull your yarn through
